conversation.text: I'd be happy to help! Based on your preference for European movies, I recommend you check out "The Queen" (2004). This thought-provoking film stars Helen Mirren as Queen Elizabeth II, exploring her personal struggles following the death of Princess Diana. Another great choice is "Prometheus" (2012), an engaging science fiction film set in end-of-millennium Europe, featuring an all-star cast including Noomi Rapace and Charlize Theron. Enjoy the movies!

Both "Monsters, Inc." and "Hitch" are excellent choices!

If you're looking for a family-friendly film with a touch of humor, "Monsters, Inc." is a heartwarming tale about friendship and understanding, featuring the voice talents of Billy Crystal, John Goodman, and Steve Buscemi.

On the other hand, if you prefer more adult themes and drama, "Hitch" starring Will Smith and Eva Mendes tells a story of romance and personal growth that will surely entertain.

Based on your preference for films set around 2010 and a touch of romance like Tangled, I'd recommend "Little Women" (2010). This period drama follows the lives and growth of four sisters in post-Civil War America and stars talented actors such as Meryl Streep and Amy Adams.

Alternatively, if you fancy a mix of comedy, crime, and supernatural elements, "How to Train Your Dragon" (2010) might appeal to you. This animated adventure features the voices of Jay Baruchel, Kristen Wiig, and Gerard Butler, and tells the story of a young Viking who befriends a dragon instead of hunting it. Enjoy your movie time!

Among the films you mentioned, "Inception" and "The King's Speech" both stand out as intriguing choices that might align with the mood of 'Torment'.

"Inception", directed by Christopher Nolan, is a thought-provoking thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, and Ellen Page. It revolves around a team of thieves who can enter people's dreams to steal or plant ideas, offering an engaging exploration of reality and the human psyche.

On the other hand, "The King's Speech", directed by Tom Hooper, is a historical drama featuring Colin Firth as King George VI. The film follows his journey to overcome a severe stammer with the help of an unorthodox speech therapist, which offers a poignant portrayal of personal struggles and resilience.
